title: Can't install tensorflow because of bazel
body:
I am trying to install tensor flow for cpu via spack.  It falls over at bazel:
```
==> Installing bazel
==> Searching for binary cache of bazel
==> No binary for bazel found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /lus/theta-fs0/projects/datascience/cadams/spack/cooley/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/c0/c0e94f8f818759f3f67af798c38683520c540f469cb41aea8f5e5a0e43f11600.zip
==> Staging archive: /tmp/cadams/spack-stage/spack-stage-bazel-0.26.1-4mmpkcidyja4i6smxm2ahqifvh322xsz/bazel-0.26.1-dist.zip
==> Created stage in /tmp/cadams/spack-stage/spack-stage-bazel-0.26.1-4mmpkcidyja4i6smxm2ahqifvh322xsz
==> Applied patch /lus/theta-fs0/projects/datascience/cadams/spack/cooley/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/bazel/bazelruleclassprovider-0.25.patch
==> Applied patch /lus/theta-fs0/projects/datascience/cadams/spack/cooley/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/bazel/unix_cc_configure-0.15.patch
==> Applied patch /lus/theta-fs0/projects/datascience/cadams/spack/cooley/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/bazel/compile-0.21.patch
==> Building bazel [Package]
==> Executing phase: 'bootstrap'
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> Error: FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'output/bazel'

/lus/theta-fs0/projects/datascience/cadams/spack/cooley/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/bazel/package.py:136, in install:
        134    def install(self, spec, prefix):
        135        mkdir(prefix.bin)
  >>    136        install('output/bazel', prefix.bin)

See build log for details:
  /tmp/cadams/spack-stage/spack-stage-bazel-0.26.1-4mmpkcidyja4i6smxm2ahqifvh322xsz/spack-build-out.txt
```
Here was the command I have used:
```console
$ spack install py-tensorflow@1.15 cuda_arch=35 ^cuda@10.1 %gcc@6.3.0
```

And, I am on this system:
```
$ uname -a
Linux cc047 3.10.0-957.27.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jul 9 16:53:14 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release
LSB Version:	:core-4.1-amd64:core-4.1-noarch
```

Any ideas for how to fix this?  I have the latest version of spack as of this morning.  Is there an older version of bazel that will work?
